name: Tricolor Chinese Evergreen
description: Aglaonema pictum 'Tricolor' is a variegated form of Aglaonema pictum, a terrestrial plant native to the tropical rainforests of Sumatra, Indonesia. It belongs to the Araceae family and features upright stems (30-60 cm tall) with large, dramatic, variegated leaves featuring green, white, and cream tricolor variegation in a distinctive camouflage pattern. The plant displays an upright, bushy growth habit. In its native rainforest habitat, this plant grows in the humid understory with filtered light and high humidity. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers. In its native habitat, it grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds vibrant colors and visual interest with its distinctive tricolor variegation. It's extremely popular among houseplant enthusiasts for its unique camouflage-patterned foliage.
careTips: Keep soil consistently moist but well-draining
Toxic if ingested - keep away from pets and children
